revised_title: On the Composition of Chloride of Barium: A Chemical Analysis
tldr: The author investigated the composition of chloride of barium, focusing on its chemical equivalents and the accuracy of previous experiments. They employed methods to ensure the purity of substances and found that 100 parts of chloride of barium correspond to 137*63 parts of the chloride of silver. The real equivalent of barium depends on the equivalent of chlorine, which is not yet satisfactorily determined.
